p: Detection in cell culture requires prolonged incubation and is both insensitive and often impractical. Shell vial culture offers increased sensitivity over traditional culture [ 184, 328]. IFA has demonstrated a sensitivity of 73 % and specificity of 97 % with RT-PCR as the gold standard [ 329]. DFA has shown similar results [ 330]. Commercial antibody kits for immunofluorescent detection of MPV are available. RT-PCR is most commonly used for detection of the virus in epidemiologic studies and is becoming more common in clinical laboratories [ 176, 320, 331, 332]. Real-time RT-PCR targeting the conserved N gene has high sensitivity for detection of all four subgroups [ 189, 195].
